resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: Migrate command fails in multiple AZ environment

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: In multi-cluster configuration, migrations using --source broken for all clusters but first registered.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
In a multi-cluster setup, with one CLC, two CCs, and two NCs on each of the CCs (7 systems total), I found that migrations work fine on one of the clusters (the "zero-index" cluster?). On the other cluster, however, migrations work only when initiated using --instance; migrations initiated with --source fail with  the following error: 

{quote}
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to find ENABLED cluster for node 10.111.5.35
{quote}

This error occurs regardless of whether a migration is running on the other cluster.

In fact, simultaneous migrations on two different clusters are working--but only if the migration is initiated using --instance on the problem cluster.

Here's a bit of a transcript:

{quote}
\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-describe-nodes
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.35	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.34	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-91D944E4
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.40	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-BFCF46A3
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.32	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-C9853ED9

\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.32

\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.40
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to find ENABLED cluster for node 10.111.5.40

\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.40
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to find ENABLED cluster for node 10.111.5.40

\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-describe-nodes
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.35	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.34	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-91D944E4
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.40	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-BFCF46A3
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.32	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-C9853ED9	MIGRATING-TO	10.111.5.34

\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.40
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to find ENABLED cluster for node 10.111.5.40

\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --instance i-BFCF46A3
\[root@h-10 ~\]#
{quote}

To my last point above, I did run concurrent migrations successfully on the clusters:

{quote}
\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.34

\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.35
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to find ENABLED cluster for node 10.111.5.35

\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --instance i-BFCF46A3

\[root@h-10 ~\]# euca-describe-nodes
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.35	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-BFCF46A3	MIGRATING-TO	10.111.5.40
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.34	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-91D944E4	MIGRATING-TO	10.111.5.32
INSTANCE	i-C9853ED9	MIGRATING-TO	10.111.5.32
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.40	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.32	ENABLED
{quote}
fields.summary: In multi-cluster configuration, migrations using --source broken for all clusters but first registered.
fields.environment: One CLC and two (or more) CCs, each with two NCs.

comments.body: Unless this is a symptom of a deeper, more deleterious, problem, I would consider this a "Known Issue" material for 3.3.0 and something to fix in 3.3.1
I plan to poke at it a bit more, perhaps trying it with a three-cluster setup to see how it behaves there--to ensure it's possible to migrate instances on all clusters by at least one method.

I just built a three-cluster cloud, and I used it to verify that migrations using --source are broken for all clusters but the first one registered. (Migrations using --instance work, though, and I verified that simultaneous migrations can be launched on all three clusters.)

More example behavior:

{quote}
\[root@h-02 ~\]# euca-describe-nodes
NODE	PARTI02		10.111.5.35	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-B53A40FF
NODE	PARTI02		10.111.5.34	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.32	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.13	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-4B394455
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.12	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.15	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-F63F3F43

\[root@h-02 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.15
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to find ENABLED cluster for node 10.111.5.15

\[root@h-02 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.35
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to find ENABLED cluster for node 10.111.5.35

\[root@h-02 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.13

\[root@h-02 ~\]# euca-describe-nodes
NODE	PARTI02		10.111.5.35	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-B53A40FF
NODE	PARTI02		10.111.5.34	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.32	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.13	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-4B394455	MIGRATING-TO	10.111.5.12
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.12	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.15	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-F63F3F43
{quote}

Only the migration on PARTI00 could be launched using --source.

The other two clusters could only launch migrations using --instance:

{quote}
\[root@h-02 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.35
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to find ENABLED cluster for node 10.111.5.35

\[root@h-02 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.15
Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to find ENABLED cluster for node 10.111.5.15

\[root@h-02 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --instance i-B53A40FF

\[root@h-02 ~\]# euca-migrate-instances --instance i-F63F3F43

\[root@h-02 ~\]# euca-describe-nodes
NODE	PARTI02		10.111.5.35	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-B53A40FF	MIGRATING-TO	10.111.5.34
NODE	PARTI02		10.111.5.34	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.32	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.13	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-4B394455	MIGRATING-TO	10.111.5.12
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.12	ENABLED
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.15	ENABLED
INSTANCE	i-F63F3F43	MIGRATING-TO	10.111.5.32
{quote}
I just verified in the cc.log that the CC never receives a request, so the problem here is at the CLC level.
[~awithrow], [~tjcramer], fixed in 3.3.0? If not, we need to release note this.
Yep, this one's in the RN via DOC-861.

Test case:
[CLC WS]
[CC00 SC00] [CC01 SC01]
[NC00] [NC00] [NC01] [NC01]

1- Start an instance on the second cluster
2- Migrate this instance using the --source and --dest flags.

{code}
[root@c-15 ~]# euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION	r-F6864244	351097676741	default
INSTANCE	i-F59944BD	emi-63323B0A	10.111.101.45	172.26.114.42	running	chuck	0		m1.small	2013-06-25T20:22:34.300Z	PARTI01	eki-39F83933	eri-28293750		monitoring-disabled	10.111.101.45	172.26.114.42			instance-store											
TAG	instance	i-F59944BD	euca:node	10.111.5.40
[root@c-15 ~]# euca-migrate-instances --source=10.111.5.40 --dest=10.111.5.41
[root@c-15 ~]# euca-describe-instance
-bash: euca-describe-instance: command not found
[root@c-15 ~]# euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION	r-F6864244	351097676741	default
INSTANCE	i-F59944BD	emi-63323B0A	10.111.101.45	172.26.114.42	running	chuck	0		m1.small	2013-06-25T20:22:34.300Z	PARTI01	eki-39F83933	eri-28293750		monitoring-disabled	10.111.101.45	172.26.114.42			instance-store											
TAG	instance	i-F59944BD	euca:node	10.111.5.40
TAG	instance	i-F59944BD	euca:node:migration:state	preparing
[root@c-15 ~]# euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION	r-F6864244	351097676741	default
INSTANCE	i-F59944BD	emi-63323B0A	10.111.101.45	172.26.114.42	running	chuck	0		m1.small	2013-06-25T20:22:34.300Z	PARTI01	eki-39F83933	eri-28293750		monitoring-disabled	10.111.101.45	172.26.114.42			instance-store											
TAG	instance	i-F59944BD	euca:node	10.111.5.41
[root@c-15 ~]# euca-describe-nodes 
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.40	ENABLED	
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.5.34	ENABLED	
NODE	PARTI00		10.111.1.55	ENABLED	
NODE	PARTI01		10.111.5.41	ENABLED	
INSTANCE	i-F59944BD
{code}
Fixed. Tested with 2 clusters. Migration works for each cluster. Also, tested w/ w/o volume attached.
